metadata.title: CVE-2019-14459 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
nfdump 1.6.17 and earlier is affected by an integer overflow in thefunction Process_ipfix_template_withdraw in ipfix.c that can be abused inorder to crash the process remotely (denial of service).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14459` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nfdump - 1.6.18-1
nfdump-sflow - 1.6.18-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: nfdump package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.18-1').
